OSCE_Examination.Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the patient for the cause of anemia, weight loss, and deteriorating renal function.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient reports feeling weaker over the past few months and notices unintentional weight loss. She denies any recent infections, bleeding, or changes in urination. She mentions a previous blood workup indicating elevated BUN and creatinine levels.
Patient_Actor.Past_Medical_History: Hypertension treated with medication. Father had kidney stones.
Patient_Actor.Social_History: Non-smoker, occasional alcohol use. Works as an accountant.
Patient_Actor.Review_of_Systems: Denies fever, nausea, vomiting, diarrhea, dysuria, or change in bowel habits.

Ultrasound_Kidneys.Findings: Bilateral reduced kidney size with increased echogenicity, no obstructive pathology

OSCE_Examination.Objective_for_Doctor: Assess and diagnose the elderly patient presenting for an annual blood pressure visit with incidental lab findings.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents for his annual blood pressure visit with no complaints other than occasional knee pain. He has a past medical history of hypertension and knee osteoarthritis, for which he takes occasional acetaminophen.
Patient_Actor.Social_History: Diet rich in vegetables, daily exercise, no history of smoking. A brother died at 84 due to hematologic malignancy.
Patient_Actor.Review_of_Systems: Denies headache, dizziness, chest pain, palpitations, dyspnea, fever, weight loss, or night sweats.

Musculoskeletal_Examination.Range_of_Motion: Reduced range of motion in both knees.
Musculoskeletal_Examination.Palpation: Crepitus noted in both knees, no swelling or warmth.

OSCE_Examination.Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate and manage a patient presenting with fatigue, episodes of lower abdominal pain, and a self-stated high cancer concern.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient reports a 2-month history of persistent fatigue and several episodes of lower abdominal pain. Despite being on sick leave for 2 weeks, symptoms have not improved. She expresses a concern that she might have cancer and requests a diagnostic laparoscopy. She was diagnosed with peptic ulcer disease 6 months ago.
Patient_Actor.Past_Medical_History: Diagnosed with peptic ulcer disease 6 months prior, currently taking omeprazole.
Patient_Actor.Social_History: Works as a nurse, has been under a lot of stress at work.

Review_of_Systems.Skin: Numerous crusts along the left arm veins
Review_of_Systems.Cardiovascular: Grade 2/6 systolic ejection murmur along the right-upper sternal border
Review_of_Systems.Musculoskeletal: Generalized weakness of the proximal muscles

Physical_Examination_Findings.General_Appearance: Patient appears pale, fatigued, and has dry mucous membranes.
Physical_Examination_Findings.Skin: Crusts noted along the course of veins on left arm.
Physical_Examination_Findings.Cardiovascular: A grade 2/6 systolic ejection murmur is appreciated along the right-upper sternal border.
Physical_Examination_Findings.Neurological: Generalized weakness noted, particularly in proximal muscle groups.

OSCE_Examination.Objective_for_Doctor: Assess and manage the patient presenting with altered mental status, autonomic dysregulation, and muscle rigidity.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient was brought to the emergency department by police after he was found undressing himself outside in extremely hot weather. The patient is uncooperative, refusing to answer questions due to paranoia about being spied on. He has a history of polysubstance abuse and a recent visit to the ED for intoxication.
Patient_Actor.Social_History: Recently started college. Known history of substance use.
Patient_Actor.Review_of_Systems: Unable to obtain due to patient's non-compliance and altered mental status.

Neurological_Examination.Autonomic_Signs: Dry mucous membranes indicating possible dehydration

CBC.White_Blood_Cell_Count: Normal range but specifics not provided
CBC.Hemoglobin: Normal range but specifics not provided
CBC.Platelets: Normal range but specifics not provided

Renal_Function_Tests.Creatinine: Within normal limits but specifics not provided
Renal_Function_Tests.BUN: Within normal limits but specifics not provided

Blood_Gas_Analysis.Findings: Mild metabolic acidosis (specific values not provided)

OSCE_Examination.Objective_for_Doctor: Assess and manage a patient presenting with symptoms suggestive of early pregnancy.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents requesting prenatal care, reporting 2 months of increasing breast tenderness, nausea, a 6.6 lb weight gain, increased urinary frequency, and uncertainty about the date of her last menstrual period. She stopped taking oral contraceptives 6 months ago and has been trying to conceive with her husband since then. She believes she is pregnant and was happy to share this news with her husband last week.
Patient_Actor.Past_Medical_History: Stopped oral contraceptives 6 months prior in an attempt to conceive.
Patient_Actor.Social_History: Reports being in a stable relationship and actively trying to conceive with her husband.
Patient_Actor.Review_of_Systems: Denies fever, vomiting, diarrhea, dysuria, or flank pain.

Abdominal_Examination.Palpation: No tenderness, masses, or abnormalities noted.

Pelvic_Examination.Speculum_Examination: Closed cervical os, no abnormalities detected.
Pelvic_Examination.Bimanual_Examination: Normal adnexa and uterus, no tenderness or masses palpated.

Transvaginal_Ultrasound.Findings: No abnormalities detected, absence of gestational sac.

OSCE_Examination.Objective_for_Doctor: Assess and diagnose the patient presenting with knee swelling and pain, who has a history of arthritis and additional musculoskeletal complaints.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with a complaint of right knee swelling and pain that has recently exacerbated. He notes that his left knee was similarly swollen a few weeks ago, but has since improved. He has been experiencing difficulties walking and performing daily activities due to the pain, which he describes as significantly improving with rest. Additionally, he mentions having persistent back pain that contributes to his restricted mobility. The patient also suffers from dandruff and has been using special shampoos to manage it.

Secondary_Symptoms: Difficulty walking and performing daily activities

Patient_Actor.Past_Medical_History: Diagnosed with arthritis 16 years ago. No other significant medical history provided.
Patient_Actor.Social_History: Does not provide specific details on lifestyle, smoking, or alcohol use.
Patient_Actor.Review_of_Systems: Mentions general frustration over the limitations imposed by his symptoms but does not report any other systemic complaints.

Musculoskeletal_Examination.Inspection: Visible swelling of the right knee. Pitting of the nails noted.
Musculoskeletal_Examination.Palpation: Warmth and tenderness over the right knee joint. No similar findings in the left knee.
Musculoskeletal_Examination.Range_of_Motion: Reduced range of motion in the right knee due to pain and swelling.
Musculoskeletal_Examination.Additional_Findings: Back examination shows limited spine mobility but without acute tenderness.

X-Ray_Right_Knee.Findings: Joint space narrowing, subchondral sclerosis, and no evidence of erosive disease.

X-Ray_Spine.Findings: Slight degenerative changes but no evidence of sacroiliitis

OSCE_Examination.Objective_for_Doctor: Assess and manage a patient presenting with right arm pain, gastrointestinal symptoms, and a history of similar presentations.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents to the emergency room with complaints of right arm pain, limited range of motion, diarrhea, and nausea. She reports no recent trauma to the arm. She also experiences pain during intercourse. The patient has a significant history of being in the ER multiple times in the past year with similar symptoms.

Symptoms.Primary_Symptom: Right arm pain with limited range of motion
Secondary_Symptoms: Vague and diffuse abdominal tenderness without signs of inflammation on the arm

Patient_Actor.Past_Medical_History: Frequent ER visits with similar presentation. No significant past surgical history.
Patient_Actor.Social_History: Sexually active with one male partner.
Patient_Actor.Review_of_Systems: Denies recent illness, fever, vomiting. No significant weight changes or chronic illnesses.

Abdominal_Examination.Percussion: Diffuse tenderness, but no peritoneal signs.
Abdominal_Examination.Palpation: Diffuse abdominal tenderness in all four quadrants without rebound or guarding.

OSCE_Examination.Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the patient presenting with severe chest pain and provide a diagnosis based on the clinical findings and test results presented.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient was brought to the emergency department by her brother due to severe chest pain. She recently lost her husband in a tragic car accident and has been experiencing a significant amount of emotional stress.

Secondary_Symptoms: Emotional stress due to recent loss
No significant past medical history mentioned

Patient_Actor.Past_Medical_History: No significant past medical history. Patient is experiencing acute emotional and psychological stress.
Patient_Actor.Social_History: No specific details provided. Attention to recent emotional trauma is noted.
Patient_Actor.Review_of_Systems: The patient appears to be in distress due to chest pain and recent emotional events. Denies history of similar episodes.

Cardiac_Examination.Lung_Auscultation: Rales in the lower right and left lung lobes

Echocardiography.Findings: Enlarged left ventricle and left atrium
